channel.title: Firsts on Year Zero
channel.description: Recent content in Firsts on Year Zero

item.title: Firsts
item.description:
New Firsts

Part of my ethic for Year Zero is to do new things. These are some of the new things that I’ve done and new things I’ve achieved.

  • 15 February - Seminar at Harvard University
  • 10 April - Review paper published (on Robotic Telescopes in Education)
  • 7 April - Appeared on Radio 1 Newsbeat talking about exoplanets
  • 5 May - Hiked to the top of Snowdon
  • 27 May - Saw Alien in the undercroft of Cardiff Castle
  • 1 June - Travelled in the HeathrowPod to Terminal 5
  • 23 June - Visit to Disneyland, Anaheim, California
  • 5 July - Trip to Norway and drank brandy from a hip-flask at the foot of a glacier
  • 8 September - Was under curfew because of a hurricane, Hurricane Irma, Orlando, Florida
  • 4 October - Visited Finland for a conference of 100 innovators in education, HundrED, Helsinki

Old Firsts

There are plenty of things that I enjoy doing, which are significant. I’m going to log these here too. Don’t worry, its not going to feature anything too personal.

  • Science of Doctor Who talk - 25 January, British Science Fiction Association, London
  • Radio Appearance - 14 March, Science Cafe, BBC Radio Wales
  • Trip to Leiden, Netherlands - 8 May, Python in Astronomy, Lorentz Centre
  • Trip to California (to LCO headquarters) - 1 June
  • Conference talk (at Robotic Telescope, Student Research, and Education) - 21 June, San Diego
